section.name: Roadmap
section.p:
The different eDelivery concepts of the Large Scale Pilot Projects currently are subject to convergence activities; consolidation and alignment of the different approaches will be one major task of the e-SENS LSP planned to be launched beginning of 2013.
For SPOCS eDelivery, following enhancements where already discussed during project lifetime:
Placement of Gateway meta-data (actually carried in SPOCS TL extension)in a separate file metadata.xml. Presumably a converged solution will adopt the PEPPOL concept "Service Metadata Publisher" (SMP)"Service Metadata Locator" (SML) for this functionality. The future converged solution should be transparent for adapters to national solutions.
Validiation of authentication level as required by targeted eDelivery system against the one provided by the Sender of a message.
Isolation of Evidence generation and Evidence validation in separate trusted function modules or even service nodes, to be activatable from any eDelivery infrastructure component via a standardized interface
Same for SAML Sender Vouches Token
Enhanced generalized stylesheets for visualization of Evidences and SAMl Tokens, to be used by national solutions for convenience.
Each of this function blocks needs a detailed concept and should fit in the more generalized architecture as envisaged by e-SENS. Thus, the realization was postponed from the SPOCS to the e-SENS LSP.
